Key: (All right. So class has begun, but...)

(It's nice that Maria is calm, but she seems kind
of bored.)

(Maybe I can talk to her quietly... To where it
won't be disruptive to the class.)

All right, Yoshino is focused on teaching. I think
now's a good time... Maria... Maria!

What is the matter, Shido? Shouldn't you refrain
from talking during class?

Well yeah, but I was just curious about you. If
you have any questions, you can ask me.

Questions? There is nothing that I need to ask at
this moment.

I-I see. You must be smart... But I guess that
would make sense.

Oh, but you can ask about other things. Hmm, like
if you're curious about what's being taught, you
can participate in the discussion, right?

You have a point. Okay, I can try asking a few
questions.
All right, give it a shot.

Teacher, I have a question about the
subject matter.
Oh... O-Okay! Wh-What is it... Arusu-san...?
The English earlier seemed to be misused.
Wh-Wha...?
*Whisper, whisper*...
I wonder if that Arusu-san is really smart.
Maybe she's an international student?

A harsh comment toward Yoshino-sensei...! Woo,
Arusu-chan is so cool!

U-Um... I taught it exactly the way it was in the
book.
Maria... That's not good!
(I signaled an "X" to her and told her to stop.)
Shido, was there a problem with my question?

Oh uh... I think it was too harsh of a question...
Maybe you shouldn't point out any errors in the
course material?
Understood... I will improve.

I'm sorry, sensei. I mean to say, why don't you
try changing the material you are using? This one
is an older version compared to the international—
—Maria!

I thought we could resolve the issue this way...
Is that an issue?

You can't just change the school materials so
easily... Look, Yoshino is about to cry.

I can't speak the truth... Class is very
difficult.

Well, it's hard to explain, but... it's not right.
Anyways, sorry, that was my fault for suggesting
it. Give me some time.
Understood.

(I signaled Yoshino to continue on with the class.
Yoshino just became a teacher, so I feel bad for
starting all this.)

(This is going to be hard. How can I have Maria
participate in the classroom?)

(I know... Maybe I can ask someone for ideas. Who
should I ask?)
Ask Tohka to help.
Ask Origami for help.
Consult with Kurumi.
Ask for Yoshino's cooperation.
Maybe I can ask Tohka.
Tohka, can I ask you something?
Hm? What is it, Shido?

It's Maria. It seems like she's having trouble
asking the right questions during class. Do you
have any good ideas?

Oh, really? She certainly flaunted some impressive
knowledge earlier.
No, I mean something more normal.

I see. I don't know too many things, though...
I've never had difficulty in asking questions.

Oh, I see... I guess it's a completely different
case, huh?

But as it is you making the request, I will share
with Arusu my best question.

Oh! Thanks, Tohka!
...Maria, Tohka's calling you.
What is it?

Well Arusu, I think this would be the perfect
question to ask.

The answer to that question is written on the next
page.

What...? Ohh, so this is the answer?! How did you
come to that conclusion?
Well, if you look at the text here...
(Uh, this is...)

Oops. In the end, I couldn't do anything to help,
and class is already over. Sorry, Shido.
No, it's fine. I'm glad I asked you, Tohka...

Wh-What? Really? But she was the one teaching me
everything.

Well, when she was teaching you earlier, she
looked like she was having a little fun.

(No matter how hard I think, I usually fail, but
Tohka's instincts are usually spot on.)
That's what makes you amazing, Tohka.
Me, amazing? What are you talking about?
(This is also going to take some explaining...)

Shido and Tohka... Thank you for earlier. Because
of you two, I was able to gain more insight into
what a class should be.)
See? Maria's thanking you, too.
H-Hm, I suppose so... Then, no need to thank me.

Okay. Shido, there was something I was curious
about, so I'm going to leave the classroom for a
little while.
Got it. Later.
Okay. Thank you. Well, then...

Oh, crap. It's already time for the next class,
huh? Sorry, Tohka, I'm going to head out.

Okay, understood. I'll explain to the
next teacher!
Thanks!
Origami, I need to ask you something.

Got it. I will prepare immediately.
Give me a moment.
...What?

(What is she preparing for? Just as I was
wondering, Origami put her hand up her skirt...
Whoa?!)

W-Wait, Origami?! Why are you trying to take your
clothes off?!
...You said you wanted to ask me something.

But how does that end up with you taking your
underwear off?!
You don't want it?
No, I don't!
...I see.
So what is it, then?

Oh. I wanted Maria to participate in class more. I
was wondering if you had any good questions she
could ask.
Questions?
Yeah. Do you have any ideas?

I see. She should ask things that the Hermit can
answer.
You mean Yoshino?

She asks, the opponent answers. That's what you
want her to experience, right? Then the type of
question should allow for that exchange.

Oh, I see. So you're saying I shouldn't think too
hard about it. Thanks, Origami!

(Just as Origami suggested, I gave Maria topics
that Yoshino could discuss. In other words, within
the range of information in the textbook.)

(Well, it seemed like Maria already knew the
answer without having to ask, but she seems to be
understanding the benefits of asking questions.)
I think she was able to get the feel of it...
Shido...
Oh, Origami. Thanks for earlier.
No problem. I always welcome your requests.
Hahaha. But maybe I was out of line to suggest it.

Maria Arusu is very intelligent, but she lacks the
experience to adequately employ her knowledge. I
think it's good that she gets the gist of things.
Thanks, Origami.
Shido, I need to talk to you.
Sure...?

There's something I'm curious about, so I'm going
to leave the classroom for a little bit.
Hey, where are you going? Sorry, Origami... Later!
...You're welcome.
Kurumi, can I ask you something?

Oh, it's very nice that you're consulting me for
advice, Shido-san. Is it about Arusu-san?

Yeah. You see, I want her to participate in class
to get a better idea of what it really feels like.

Do you know of any good ways for her to do so,
Kurumi?
I don't believe you need to think too hard on it.
Any ideas?

I think that Arusu-san is asking questions at her
specific intelligence level. She should stop
doing that.
What do you mean?

Rather than use the knowledge with which she's
been gifted, she should only utilize information
from sources she's personally observed.

I see. So basically she's not allowed to search
the system. Thanks. I'll let her know.
Okay, I wish you the best of luck.
Thanks.

(All right, I'm going to tell Maria what Kurumi
told me.)
Maria, come here.
What is it?

Let me ask you something. How did you look up the
question you asked Yoshino?
I searched the system database.

Yeah, I figured. So let's refrain from doing that.
Why don't you try investigating on your own?
What do you mean?

You see, the point of class is to think on your
own. You may think it may not be effective, but
why don't you give it a shot?
...Understood. I will try doing as you suggested.
(I'm so glad, she seems to want to do it.)
Thanks, Kurumi. I think she'll figure it out.

You're welcome, Shido-san. I'm glad I was of help
to you.

(In the end, Arusu couldn't think of a question
for class. I guess Arusu was already really smart
even without being able to search her database...)

(But it was the first time I saw her use a
dictionary, and she seemed to be having fun.)
Thanks, Kurumi.

I haven't done anything worth thanking. Anyways...
Shido-san, you're kind to everyone, aren't you?
I'm getting kind of jealous.
Don't make me blush.
And why not? Oh... Isn't that Arusu-san?
Shido, do you have a moment?
Oh, what's up?

I'm curious about something, so I'm going to leave
the classroom for a little while.
Okay, got it... Later.
Okay, thank you.

...Hey, wait! The next class is about to begin.
Oh... She's gone.
Shouldn't you go find her?
Yeah. Sorry, Kurumi, but for the next class...

...I'll let the teacher know that you went to the
infirmary with Arusu-san.
Thanks! Later...!
But it's not good to be nice to everyone.

(After thinking about it, I asked Yoshino to help
me. While everyone else was translating a long
English sentence, I decided to plot with Yoshino.)

Yoshino! I mean, Yoshino-sensei!
I have a question...
Oh, I'll be right over...!

(All right. She seemed to have understood my
intention. Yoshino came running over.)
Sorry about earlier. So I have a favor to ask you.
Y-Yes... What is it?
Hey, hey, Shido-kuuun. This time, please refrain\nfrom a killer pass where you smack the receiver's\nface with a hunk of dirt.

Sorry about that. I thought it through this time.
For the next translation, can you call on Maria?
Oh. Arusu-san...?

Yeah, if the answer is already set, there's no way
an issue would arise, right?
I see... Okay...
You sure thought that one through, Shido-kun!\nGosh, you're so cunning!

Hahaha, it's not that big of a deal. Anyways, I'll
let Maria know.
Okay.

All right, all that's left is Maria...
Maria, you have a moment?
Shido... is this about earlier?

Yeah. This one's a long sentence. Why don't you
try answering it?
...Okay.

Oh, good, good. Ah... Don't search for answers
though, okay?
...What do you mean by that?
If you do that, it's basically cheating, isn't it?
You have a point. I'll... give it a shot.

(After hearing me out, Maria seemed to understand.
Though she stumbled a bit, she was eventually able
to translate the sentence.)
Thanks for earlier, Yoshino.
Shido-san... Anything for you...!
Shido-kun, you forgot about Yoshinon,\ndidn't you?
Ah, Yoshinon. Thank you, too.
Shido, I need to talk to you.
Sure. What is it, Maria?

I'm curious about something, so I'm going to leave
the classroom for a little while.
All right. See you.
Okay, thank you. Well, then...
I-I wonder what happened.
Beats me.
Shido-kun. Should you really hang around like\nthat? The next class is about to start. Is it okay\nto leave her alone?
Oh! You're right. I need to go find her.
O-Oh... Shido-san...!
What is it, Yoshino?
G-Good luck...!
Thanks, Yoshino. Well then... Later.
